work.body: The customer noticed the presence of numerous broken images across the website. These technical issues severely impacted the website's visual appeal and professionalism, contributing to a subpar user experience
work.title: New ticket 2

issues.body: Media players on the website are not responsive or do not work properly, leading to frustration for users.
issues.title: Unresponsive Media Players

issues.body: The website's branding is inconsistent, leading to a lack of cohesion and confusion for users.
issues.title: Inconsistent Branding

issues.body: The website's content hierarchy is unclear, making it difficult for users to understand the organization of information.
issues.title: Unclear Content Hierarchy

issues.body: Landing pages on the website are poorly designed, resulting in low conversion rates.
issues.title: Poorly Designed Landing Pages

issues.body: Images on the website are missing alt text, which is an important accessibility feature for users with disabilities.
issues.title: Missing Alt Text

issues.body: Advertisements on the website are too intrusive or disruptive, leading to a poor user experience.
issues.title: Intrusive Advertisements

issues.body: Images on the website are not loading or displaying correctly, leading to a poor user experience.
issues.title: Broken Images

issues.body: The website has numerous grammar or spelling errors, which can damage the credibility of the site.
issues.title: Poor Grammar/Spelling

issues.body: The website has security vulnerabilities that could potentially lead to data breaches or other security issues.
issues.title: Security Vulnerabilities

issues.body: The calls-to-action on the website are unclear or confusing, resulting in low click-through rates.
issues.title: Confusing Call-to-Actions

issues.body: Forms on the website are not responding or submitting properly, causing frustration for users.
issues.title: Unresponsive Forms

issues.body: The website has too many pop-ups, which can be annoying or intrusive for users.
issues.title: Too Many Pop-ups

issues.body: The website is not accessible to users with disabilities, which can lead to a poor user experience for those users.
issues.title: Lack of Accessibility

issues.body: The website has an inconsistent design, with different sections of the site looking and behaving differently.
issues.title: Inconsistent Design

issues.body: Some of the content on the website is no longer relevant or up-to-date.
issues.title: Outdated Content

issues.body: The search feature on the website is not effective, making it difficult for users to find what they are looking for.
issues.title: Poor Search Functionality

issues.body: Users are having difficulty finding the information they need due to a confusing or unclear navigation structure.
issues.title: Unintuitive Navigation

issues.body: The website doesn't render well on mobile devices, resulting in a poor user experience.
issues.title: Poor Mobile Responsiveness

issues.body: The website takes too long to load, which can result in a poor user experience.
issues.title: Slow Loading Speed

issues.body: Pls fix fast
issues.title: Fix bug X

issues.body:
Install the PLuG widget into your application with just a few lines of code and immediately bring the voice of your customer to your entire team. 

You can also test the PLuG widget by clicking DevRev Org settings (top left DevRev icon) -> Support -> PLuG Settings -> View PLuG in Playground.

Follow step by step guide and copy and paste code from the link here -> https://docs.devrev.ai/integrations/plug
issues.title: 'Install PLuG Today!' - Needs Dev Attention

issues.body:
Your PLuG inbox is your home to communicate and resolve customer questions across chat, email, and social channels. 

But, sometimes a conversation just isn't enough. Tickets help you memoralize the customer ask, track your tasks to resolution, and bring in the right folks to help solve the problem fast. 

Let's get started by installing your PLuG widget, but don't worry you aren't alone.  The attached Issue has everything you need to bring the voice of your customer to DevRev.  

Need development help? Invite a fellow engineer to DevRev and assign the linked Issue to them to start embedding PLuG today!
issues.title: PLuG Conversations to Tickets

issues.body:
DevRev's actions are always a keystroke away.  Do more, faster with our default shortcuts and commands.

- Find what you're looking for with Global Search
- Use Command/Control + K to pull up the global search.
issues.title: Productivity Boosts: Shortcuts and Commands

issues.body:
DevRev can help link customer conversations and tickets with developer issues. Once connected, the DevRev Flows engine can ensure updates to your customer around their most critical items.

We also make it easy to find and link similar issues so that teams can align on duplicate work and dependencies to deliver the most value to your customer. 

You can  # mention work items and @ mention people to make your discussions more contextual and actionable. 

--------


It's easy to reference another record in DevRev; you can @ mention people, and use # to mention a work item, but sometimes you need something more structured.

Linked records allow you to connect Issues to Tickets, Tickets to conversations, or within an object type.  Once connected, the DevRev Flows engine can ensure updates communicate across records so everyone understands the latest stage of your work.
issues.title: The Power of Links

issues.body: Check out the updates page from the left side menu. Here you can find latest updates on work items that are relevant to you, see who has assigned you work, @ mentioned you or replied to your discussions.
issues.title: No FOMO with DevRev Updates

issues.body:
Vistas are your best friend when it comes to organizing your work. They are saved views that allow you to quickly check on your work. 

To create a Vista sort and filter your data and click the "Save As" button in the upper right corner. 

You can share it with others or keep Vistas private.  To access saved Vistas, simply click on them in the left-hand navigation.
issues.title: Organize and share your works with Vistas

issues.body:
Never ask if someone created a new sprint again or added items from the backlog.

Continuous Planning is now easier than ever with Now, Next, and Later.  

Now and Next = Your current sprint.  Next, is what's planned and the different stages of 'now' help you understand where the work is in development.

Later = The sprint after this, using workflows you can auto-populate Now/Next once a sprint concludes.

Backlog = With DevRev we give you insight into the weight of what customers have asked for in Tickets, and what was in your planned roadmap; to ensure your backlog is constantly reprioritized with items that make the biggest impact.
issues.title: Stay organized with Now, Next, Later

issues.body:
Under Trails, you can create products, capabilities and features to help organize your work.

Use our discovery feature to add Dev Parts like microservices, and connect these to your features for complete visibility into your product architecture.
issues.title: Create your Parts

issues.body:
Connect your legacy app and sync your data to start building faster.  

If you use Jira or GitHub Issues, you can connect it to DevRev to populate your Issues.  

We will be continually offer additional CRM integrations, shoot us a note in the PLuG widget to let us know what integrations would be helpful.
issues.title: Migrate to DevRev with Airdrop!
